sys_ui_page.html:
Embedded Content Application by Devendor Tech LLC

Description

The Embedded Content Application allows servicenow developers to easily access a read only copy of embedded ui.jform, ui.jtemplate, and ui javascript content that is otherwise hidden as a file structure under the hood.

This is accomplished by finding the data and copying it into a series of tables in the Embedded Content scoped application. Of course the embedded content is protected from scoped applications by denying access to some APIs needed to find and access this content.

The Embedded Content app works around by using a global sys_script_include and sys_script_action that responds to sysevents sent via UI actions from the Scoped Application counterpart. The two Global components find the content, and update the tables with a copy of the hidden content files. The slight of hand is completed via the Sync Content Process State table that collects statistics for various runs of the sync process and allows the scoped application to be aware of any currently running sync process.

The approach to working around scoped application limitations serves as a good example of how a developer can deploy any type of application without polluting global or undermining the security and order provided by the scoped counterpart.

Installation

Warning! This application is intended for development environments.

While an attempt has been made to limit risk, it does contain a global component, and your milage may vary. The application gives developers access to some extra data so they can inductively learn from otherwise hidden code. There should be no need to put this on a production instance.

  1. Download the$[AMP]nbsp;
  2. Navigate to System Update Sets/Retrieved Update Sets
  3. Use the Import Update Set From XML link to load the update set.
  4. Preview and apply the update set through the action buttons on the remote update set record created by the import.
  5. Navigate to the various content tables provided by the scoped application and use the Sync Content table action to pull in the hidden content.
  6. Optionally: navigate to a plugin record and add the embedded content related list.

Application Roles

The application contains two roles

x_dete_emb.edded_content_admin
Allows updating and creating the cached records through the expose Sync Content button on list views for embedded content.
x_dete_emb.edded_content_admin
Provides basic read access to the content.

Troubleshooting

Sync Content button missing
Button visibility is based on role and if an existing sync process is running. The sysevents table can't be checked directly, so the app depends on a boolean x_dete_emb_sync_content_process_state.complete flag set by the global sync process. If this doesn't reappear, either the process is still spinning, or it crashed out without updating the flag to True. Check sysevents and transactions to make sure it is not running away, and manually set the completed = true.
Something else
There is a lot of logging from the script include. There is a chance that one of the unpublished APIs just changed and what is happening in the app is now restricted. It is just as likely that you have found a bug. Since you are also a developer, feel free to fix it!

About Devendor Tech LLC

Devendor Tech LLC is primarily Ray and ambition at this point. "We" are a technology partner and can deliver scoped applications through the servicenow store, but I am also actively working as a consulting servicenow developer to maintain stable income while picking away at projects under the LLC. If you like my work, feel free to send me some. I would love to see what we can build together!
